handNote.p: Main hand: late square minuscule, occasional raising of e; makes self corrections by erasing and rewriting or by superlinear addition with slim insertion mark; belly of g very dominant and often extends quite far to the left with rather smaller loop; left branch of y is usually a bit curved; belly of thorn and wynn upward-looking, while still remaining rounded, and quite compact (about half as wide as belly of p). Skilled, very regular, upright, and elegant hand

Emendor in darker ink, large writing comparatively, e often open/gapped at the top, noticeable but slight lean to the upper right, rather irregular and not a very good hand but able to imitate the main hand tolerably well, underlines with wiggly underline for deletions, sometimes erases and writes over main text, makes vocabulary swaps, corrects Latin biblical quotations.
Emendor in dark ink, smaller writing, e with long extravagant tongue when in final position, uses h/ð signe-de-renvoi in other homilies (main is also possibly attested to do this on p. 46).
